intro: Dipteracanthus australasicus subsp. corynothecus, commonly known as the narrow-leafed dipteracanthus, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as understorey forests. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a distinct midrib, while the flowers are usually white or pale pink. The subspecies is distinguished by its narrower leaves and specific floral morphology compared to other members of the species.
